alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Jackson; Lewis; Pleasants; Ritchie; Tyler; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 12:34PM EST until February 04 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in southeast Ohio, Washington. In West Virginia, Calhoun, Doddridge, Gilmer, Harrison, Jackson, Lewis, Pleasants, Ritchie, Tyler, Wirt and Wood. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1230 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate flooding is occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding is occurring on Middle Island Creek, Duck Creek, the Little Muskingum River, and the West Fork River. Major flooding is occurring on Middle Island Creek near Little. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarksburg, Marietta, Harrisville, St. Marys, Elizabeth, Bridgeport, Williamstown, Shinnston, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Salem, Sistersville, Pennsboro, Belmont, Lumberport, West Union, Anmoore, North Bend State Park, Boaz and Mineralwells. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Harrison; Jackson; Lewis; Pleasants; Ritchie; Tyler; Wirt; Wood
